icon.description: base64 128x128 image for the guild icon

system_channel_id.description: the id of the channel where guild notices such as welcome messages and boost events are posted

with_counts.description: when true, will return approximate member and presence counts for the guild

icon.description: base64 1024x1024 png/jpeg/gif image for the guild icon (can be animated gif when the server has the ANIMATED_ICON feature)

owner_id.description: user id to transfer guild ownership to (must be owner)

discovery_splash.description: base64 16:9 png/jpeg image for the guild discovery splash (when the server has the DISCOVERABLE feature)

banner.description: base64 16:9 png/jpeg image for the guild banner (when the server has the BANNER feature)

rules_channel_id.description: the id of the channel where Community guilds display rules and/or guidelines

public_updates_channel_id.description: the id of the channel where admins and moderators of Community guilds receive notices from Discord

preferred_locale.description: the preferred locale of a Community guild used in server discovery and notices from Discord; defaults to "en-US"

description.description: the description for the guild, if the guild is discoverable

premium_progress_bar_enabled.description: whether the guild's boost progress bar should be enabled.

bitrate.description: the bitrate (in bits) of the voice channel (voice only)

user_limit.description: the user limit of the voice channel (voice only)

rate_limit_per_user.description: amount of seconds a user has to wait before sending another message (0-21600); bots, as well as users with the permission manage_messages or manage_channel, are unaffected

parent_id.description: id of the parent category for a channel

lock_permissions.description: syncs the permission overwrites with the new parent, if moving to a new category

parent_id.description: the new parent ID for the channel that is moved

limit.description: max number of members to return (1-1000)

after.description: the highest user id in the previous page

large.description: true if this is considered a large guild

max_video_channel_users.description: the maximum amount of users in a video channel

approximate_presence_count.description: approximate number of non-offline members in this guild, returned from the GET /guilds/<id> endpoint when with_counts is true

welcome_screen.description: the welcome screen of a Community guild, shown to new members, returned in an Invite's guild object

guild_scheduled_events.description: the scheduled events in the guild

premium_progress_bar_enabled.description: whether the guild has the boost progress bar enabled

unavailableGuild.description: A partial guild object. Represents an Offline Guild, or a Guild whose information has not been provided through Guild Create events during the Gateway connect.

approximate_member_count.description: approximate number of members in this guild

approximate_presence_count.description: approximate number of online members in this guild

description.description: the description for the guild, if the guild is discoverable

user.description: the user this guild member represents

joined_at.description: when the user joined the guild

premium_since.description: when the user started boosting the guild

deaf.description: whether the user is deafened in voice channels

mute.description: whether the user is muted in voice channels

pending.description: whether the user has not yet passed the guild's Membership Screening requirements

permissions.description: total permissions of the member in the channel, including overwrites, returned when in the interaction object

role_id.description: id that this integration uses for "subscribers"

enable_emoticons.description: whether emoticons should be synced for this integration (twitch only currently)

expire_grace_period.description: the grace period (in days) before expiring subscribers

synced_at.description: when this integration was last synced

subscriber_count.description: how many subscribers this integration has

description.description: the description of the app

bot.description: the bot associated with this application

welcome_channels.description: the channels shown in the welcome screen, up to 5

emoji_id.description: the emoji id, if the emoji is custom

emoji_name.description: the emoji name if custom, the unicode character if standard, or null if no emoji is set

membershipScreening.description: In guilds with Membership Screening enabled, when a member joins, Guild Member Add will be emitted but they will initially be restricted from doing any actions in the guild, and pending will be true in the member object. When the member completes the screening, Guild Member Update will be emitted and pending will be false.

enabled.description: whether the welcome screen is enabled

welcome_channels.description: channels linked in the welcome screen and their display options

request_to_speak_timestamp.description: sets the user's request to speak

role.description: Roles represent a set of permissions attached to a group of users. Roles have unique names, colors, and can be pinned to the side bar, causing their members to be listed separately. Roles are unique per guild, and can have separate permission profiles for the global context (guild) and channel context.

color.description: integer representation of hexadecimal color code

hoist.description: if this role is pinned in the user listing

managed.description: whether this role is managed by an integration

icon.description: the icon hash of the app

description.description: the description of the app

rpc_origins.description: an array of rpc origin urls, if rpc is enabled

bot_public.description: when false only app owner can join the app's bot to guilds

bot_require_code_grant.description: when true the app's bot will only join upon completion of the full oauth2 code grant flow

terms_of_service_url.description: the url of the app's terms of service

privacy_policy_url.description: the url of the app's privacy policy

owner.description: partial user object containing info on the owner of the application

summary.description: if this application is a game sold on Discord, this field will be the summary field for the store page of its primary sku

verify_key.description: the hex encoded key for verification in interactions and the GameSDK's GetTicket

team.description: if the application belongs to a team, this will be a list of the members of that team

guild_id.description: if this application is a game sold on Discord, this field will be the guild to which it has been linked

primary_sku_id.description: if this application is a game sold on Discord, this field will be the id of the "Game SKU" that is created, if exists

slug.description: if this application is a game sold on Discord, this field will be the URL slug that links to the store page

cover_image.description: the application's default rich presence invite cover image hash

guild_scheduled_events.description: list of guild scheduled events found in the audit log

threads.description: list of threads found in the audit log*

users.description: list of users found in the audit log

webhooks.description: list of webhooks found in the audit log

target_id.description: id of the affected entity (webhook, user, role, etc.)

user_id.description: the user who made the changes

options.description: additional info for certain action types

reason.description: the reason for the change (0-512 characters)

user_id.description: filter the log for actions made by a user

action_type.description: the type of audit log event

before.description: filter the log before a certain entry id

limit.description: how many entries are returned (default 50, minimum 1, maximum 100)

channel.description: Represents a guild or DM channel within Discord.

guild_id.description: the id of the guild (may be missing for some channel objects received over gateway guild dispatches)

permission_overwrites.description: explicit permission overwrites for members and roles

name.description: the name of the channel (1-100 characters)

last_message_id.description: the id of the last message sent in this channel (may not point to an existing or valid message)

bitrate.description: the bitrate (in bits) of the voice channel

user_limit.description: the user limit of the voice channel

rate_limit_per_user.description: amount of seconds a user has to wait before sending another message (0-21600); bots, as well as users with the permission manage_messages or manage_channel, are unaffected

owner_id.description: id of the creator of the group DM or thread

application_id.description: application id of the group DM creator if it is bot-created

parent_id.description: for guild channels: id of the parent category for a channel (each parent category can contain up to 50 channels), for threads: id of the text channel this thread was created

last_pin_timestamp.description: when the last pinned message was pinned. This may be null in events such as GUILD_CREATE when a message is not pinned.

rtc_region.description: voice region id for the voice channel, automatic when set to null

video_quality_mode.description: the camera video quality mode of the voice channel, 1 when not present

message_count.description: an approximate count of messages in a thread, stops counting at 50

member_count.description: an approximate count of users in a thread, stops counting at 50

thread_metadata.description: thread-specific fields not needed by other channels

member.description: thread member object for the current user, if they have joined the thread, only included on certain API endpoints

default_auto_archive_duration.description: default duration that the clients (not the API) will use for newly created threads, in minutes, to automatically archive the thread after recent activity, can be set to: 60, 1440, 4320, 10080

permissions.description: computed permissions for the invoking user in the channel, including overwrites, only included when part of the resolved data received on a slash command interaction

message.description: Represents a message sent in a channel within Discord.

party_id.description: party_id from a Rich Presence event

channel_id.description: id of the originating message's channel

guild_id.description: id of the originating message's guild

fail_if_not_exists.description: when sending, whether to error if the referenced message doesn't exist instead of sending as a normal (non-reply) message, default true

count.description: times this emoji has been used to react

me.description: whether the current user reacted using this emoji

overwrite.description: See permissions for more information about the allow and deny fields.

threadMetadata.description: The thread metadata object contains a number of thread-specific channel fields that are not needed by other channel types.

auto_archive_duration.description: duration in minutes to automatically archive the thread after recent activity, can be set to: 60, 1440, 4320, 10080

archive_timestamp.description: timestamp when the thread's archive status was last changed, used for calculating recent activity

locked.description: whether the thread is locked; when a thread is locked, only users with MANAGE_THREADS can unarchive it

invitable.description: whether non-moderators can add other non-moderators to a thread; only available on private threads

threadMember.description: A thread member is used to indicate whether a user has joined a thread or not.

join_timestamp.description: the time the current user last joined the thread

flags.description: any user-thread settings, currently only used for notifications

type.description: type of embed (always "rich" for webhook embeds)

description.description: description of embed

proxy_url.description: a proxied url of the image

icon_url.description: url of footer icon (only supports http(s) and attachments)

proxy_icon_url.description: a proxied url of footer icon

inline.description: whether or not this field should display inline

guild_id.description: id of the guild containing the channel

allowedMentions.description: The allowed mention field allows for more granular control over mentions without various hacks to the message content. This will always validate against message content to avoid phantom pings (e.g. to ping everyone, you must still have @everyone in the message content), and check against user/bot permissions.

parse.description: An array of allowed mention types to parse from the content.

roles.description: Array of role_ids to mention (Max size of 100)

users.description: Array of user_ids to mention (Max size of 100)

replied_user.description: For replies, whether to mention the author of the message being replied to (default false)

roles.description: roles allowed to use this emoji

require_colons.description: whether this emoji must be wrapped in colons

available.description: whether this emoji can be used, may be false due to loss of Server Boosts

guild_id.description: the guild id which the scheduled event belongs to

channel_id.description: the channel id in which the scheduled event will be hosted, or null if scheduled entity type is EXTERNAL

entity_metadata.description: additional metadata for the guild scheduled event

user_count.description: the number of users subscribed to the scheduled event

guild_scheduled_event_id.description: the scheduled event id which the user subscribed to

user.description: user which subscribed to an event

member.description: guild member data for this user for the guild which this event belongs to, if any

guildTemplate.description: Represents a code that when used, creates a guild based on a snapshot of an existing guild.

description.description: description for the template (0-120 characters)

usage_count.description: number of times this template has been used

creator_id.description: the ID of the user who created the template

creator.description: the user who created the template

updated_at.description: when this template was last synced to the source guild

source_guild_id.description: the ID of the guild this template is based on

serialized_source_guild.description: the guild snapshot this template contains

is_dirty.description: whether the template has unsynced changes

icon.description: base64 128x128 image for the guild icon

invite.description: Represents a code that when used, adds a user to a guild or group DM channel.

guild.description: the guild this invite is for

channel.description: the channel this invite is for

inviter.description: the user who created the invite

target_type.description: the type of target for this voice channel invite

target_user.description: the user whose stream to display for this voice channel stream invite

target_application.description: the embedded application to open for this voice channel embedded application invite

approximate_presence_count.description: approximate count of online members, returned from the GET /invites/<code> endpoint when with_counts is true

approximate_member_count.description: approximate count of total members, returned from the GET /invites/<code> endpoint when with_counts is true

expires_at.description: the expiration date of this invite, returned from the GET /invites/<code> endpoint when with_expiration is true

stage_instance.description: stage instance data if there is a public Stage instance in the Stage channel this invite is for

guild_scheduled_event.description: guild scheduled event data, only included if guild_scheduled_event_id contains a valid guild scheduled event id

inviteMetadata.description: Extra information about an invite, will extend the invite object.

uses.description: number of times this invite has been used

max_uses.description: max number of times this invite can be used

max_age.description: duration (in seconds) after which the invite expires

temporary.description: whether this invite only grants temporary membership

members.description: the members speaking in the Stage

participant_count.description: the number of users in the Stage

speaker_count.description: the number of users speaking in the Stage

topic.description: the topic of the Stage instance (1-120 characters)

with_counts.description: whether the invite should contain approximate member counts

with_expiration.description: whether the invite should contain the expiration date

guild_scheduled_event_id.description: the guild scheduled event to include with the invite

id.description: The id of this Stage instance

guild_id.description: The guild id of the associated Stage channel

channel_id.description: The id of the associated Stage channel

topic.description: The topic of the Stage instance (1-120 characters)

privacy_level.description: The privacy level of the Stage instance

discoverable_disabled.description: Whether or not Stage Discovery is disabled

sticker.description: Represents a sticker that can be sent in messages.

pack_id.description: for standard stickers, id of the pack the sticker is from

description.description: description of the sticker

tags.description: autocomplete/suggestion tags for the sticker (max 200 characters)

asset.description: Deprecated previously the sticker asset hash, now an empty string

available.description: whether this guild sticker can be used, may be false due to loss of Server Boosts

guild_id.description: id of the guild that owns this sticker

user.description: the user that uploaded the guild sticker

sort_value.description: the standard sticker's sort order within its pack

stickerItem.description: The smallest amount of data required to render a sticker. A partial sticker object.

stickerPack.description: Represents a pack of standard stickers.

cover_sticker_id.description: id of a sticker in the pack which is shown as the pack's icon

description.description: description of the sticker (2-100 characters)

banner_asset_id.description: id of the sticker pack's banner image

tags.description: autocomplete/suggestion tags for the sticker (max 200 characters)

file.description: the sticker file to upload, must be a PNG, APNG, or Lottie JSON file, max 500 KB

username.description: the user's username, not unique across the platform

bot.description: whether the user belongs to an OAuth2 application

system.description: whether the user is an Official Discord System user (part of the urgent message system)

mfa_enabled.description: whether the user has two factor enabled on their account

accent_color.description: the user's banner color encoded as an integer representation of hexadecimal color code

verified.description: whether the email on this account has been verified

flags.description: the flags on a user's account

premium_type.description: the type of Nitro subscription on a user's account

public_flags.description: the public flags on a user's account

connection.description: The connection object that the user has attached.

name.description: the username of the connection account

type.description: the service of the connection (twitch, youtube)

integrations.description: an array of partial server integrations

friend_sync.description: whether friend sync is enabled for this connection

show_activity.description: whether activities related to this connection will be shown in presence updates

username.description: user's username, if changed may cause the user's discriminator to be randomized.

avatar.description: if passed, modifies the user's avatar

before.description: get guilds before this guild ID

after.description: get guilds after this guild ID

limit.description: max number of guilds to return (1-200)

recipient_id.description: the recipient to open a DM channel with

access_tokens.description: access tokens of users that have granted your app the gdm.join scope

nicks.description: a dictionary of user ids to their respective nicknames

voiceState.description: Used to represent a user's voice connection status.

guild_id.description: the guild id this voice state is for

channel_id.description: the channel id this user is connected to

user_id.description: the user id this voice state is for

member.description: the guild member this voice state is for

session_id.description: the session id for this voice state

deaf.description: whether this user is deafened by the server

mute.description: whether this user is muted by the server

self_deaf.description: whether this user is locally deafened

self_mute.description: whether this user is locally muted

self_stream.description: whether this user is streaming using "Go Live"

self_video.description: whether this user's camera is enabled

suppress.description: whether this user is muted by the current user

request_to_speak_timestamp.description: the time at which the user requested to speak

optimal.description: true for a single server that is closest to the current user's client

deprecated.description: whether this is a deprecated voice region (avoid switching to these)

custom.description: whether this is a custom voice region (used for events/etc)

guild_id.description: the guild id this webhook is for, if any

channel_id.description: the new channel id this webhook should be moved to

user.description: the user this webhook was created by (not returned when getting a webhook with its token)

name.description: the default name of the webhook

avatar.description: image for the default webhook avatar

token.description: the secure token of the webhook (returned for Incoming Webhooks)

application_id.description: the bot/OAuth2 application that created this webhook

source_guild.description: the guild of the channel that this webhook is following (returned for Channel Follower Webhooks)

source_channel.description: the channel that this webhook is following (returned for Channel Follower Webhooks)

url.description: the url used for executing the webhook (returned by the webhooks OAuth2 flow)

wait.description: waits for server confirmation of message send before response (defaults to true; when false a message that is not saved does not return an error)

thread_id.description: id of the thread the message is in

username.description: override the default username of the webhook

avatar_url.description: override the default avatar of the webhook

tts.description: true if this is a TTS message

components.description: the components to include with the message

files.description: the contents of the file being sent/edited

payload_json.description: JSON encoded body of non-file params (multipart/form-data only)

attachments.description: attached files to keep and possible descriptions for new files

total.description: The total number of session starts the current user is allowed

remaining.description: The remaining number of session starts the current user is allowed

reset_after.description: The number of milliseconds after which the limit resets

max_concurrency.description: The number of identify requests allowed per 5 seconds

role.description: Roles represent a set of permissions attached to a group of users. Roles have unique names, colors, and can be "pinned" to the side bar, causing their members to be listed separately. Roles are unique per guild, and can have separate permission profiles for the global context (guild) and channel context. The @everyone role has the same ID as the guild it belongs to.

color.description: integer representation of hexadecimal color code

hoist.description: if this role is pinned in the user listing

managed.description: whether this role is managed by an integration

bot_id.description: the id of the bot this role belongs to

integration_id.description: the id of the integration this role belongs to

premium_subscriber.description: whether this is the guild's premium subscriber role
